intro: Drummondita wilsonii, commonly known as Wilson's drummondia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the arid regions of western North America, particularly in Texas and New Mexico. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a distinctive reddish hue when mature. Drummondita wilsonii is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky soils and open plains.
